website_summaries.verdict: This one is the best bang for your buck: has a solid wooden construction and is built to last through many years of use.
pros: Top points for a long lasting sturdy wooden construction
All assembly tools are included, making it super easy to put together
cons: The slats may crack upon excessive use

customer_reviews.title: Meets expectations
customer_reviews.text: All the parts came in one box. The directions was slightly different from the instructions but you really don't need them. All parts went together quickly and seems very sturdy. Arrived on time and cheaper than the box stores. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Youngerthisyear

customer_reviews.title: Below average quality. Missing parts. Math is hard.
customer_reviews.text: Product was missing three bolts and nuts, and 10 wood screws. Rather annoying that whoever was packaging the product can't count up to double digits. Some of the wood was splintered in multiple areas, slats were slightly twisted, but not bad enough that I think it'll cause an issue. I replaced the parts myself rather than dealing with the hassle of sending it back or waiting for parts. I would not purchase this again. Quality is below average and the quality control is non-existent.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Box labeled one size contained bed foundation another size... watch out!!!
customer_reviews.text: Queen size foundation packaged in a box marked “full” size foundation . While assembling, item appeared to large for rest of bed. Rooting around in bottom of box a paper was found stating item was queen sized. Origial bed was already disposed of, remaining items useless until accurate sized foundation arrived. Customer service was very difficult to wok with, ultimately I received a refund for the item and I am terminating my membership with prime. I have ordered another foundation with another company and will have it sooner than anything amazon could or would do. I am disabled and this creates a considerable hardship .
customer_reviews.author: patricia farrow

customer_reviews.title: horrible
customer_reviews.text: this thing is garbage. Craftsmanship is that of a seventh grade woodworking class. There are cracked pieces of wood everywhere, pillars don't line up, and even some mold. The thing makes so much noise too. After using it for a few weeks the squeak became unbearable and i had to reach out to warranty claim. Do not email them. It takes days to respond. After finally talking to somebody on the phone they shipped out another one and because of some issues they sent me a third one as well. Needless to say the next to replacements were just as bad as a quality. Do not buy unless you want expensive firewood
customer_reviews.author: papaphilya

customer_reviews.title: NOT WIDE ENOUGH
customer_reviews.text: Great concept however the item description is false. This full size profile foundation is listed as being 54" wide when, in fact, it is NOT. We didn't discover this until AFTER assembly and when we attempted to place foundation onto a full size bed frame, it just fell through because it wasn't wide enough. I have included photos which show that it only measures 52.5 inches. Needs to be wider so buyers beware. Frustrating because it is now my responsibility to disassemble, re-package and wait at home for a bulky pick up on an item that is incorrectly described.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Saved our T&N mattress!
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years on on our T&N mattress we had overlooked the "requirement" of needing a more supportive box spring set up. We were using our typical mattress box spring and we started getting soft spots causing back pain. We jumped for this foundation (adding the extra 1x2s and wood glue as all the reviews recommended). It went together easily, and the cover makes it looks very nice (washed it on cold and air dried before putting on the foundation). The difference was immediate and HUGE...all indentations and soft spots were GONE in the mattress and we are sleeping so well again. Best investment ever, and will last us a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Carter

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a base for a tuft & needle mattress. I was super pleasantly surprised at how easy it was to put together. I am a small 5 foot tall woman and it took me approximately two hours to put it together myself with LOTS of interruptions from my kids throughout the process. If you have a cordless drill or electric screwdriver it will go much faster, but that's not necessary. The holes are all pre-drilled the instructions are very clear. I would not hesitate to recommend or purchase this again!
customer_reviews.author: real.mrs.irvine

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure about the negative reviews here. Ours was very well made with pilot holes and clear instructions. This was very very easy to put together -- if you can do ikea or kids' toys, you can do this. Yes, there are a lot of scews but that helps provide rigidity. We are using this on an ikea bed frame for a Casper mattress. The wood is good quality as are the fasteners. This is the cheapest foundation you can get that is the same caliber as a "preassembled" one from a mattress store.
customer_reviews.author: Neuropenguin

customer_reviews.title: Find something else, this is not a box spring
customer_reviews.text: Do not think this is anywhere as sturdy as your old wood and wire box spring. The wood is incredibly soft, almost like Balsa wood and sags horribly in the middle when someone is on the bed. I thought our mattress felt different after a we woke up in the morning and felt a strange sag into the middle of the mattress. I had my girlfriend move around in the bed to see what was going on ( shes 115 pounds ) and the box spring had noticeable sag every which way she moved. This is really not acceptable
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: under a new Leesa foam mattress and I've not slept better in my 75 years
customer_reviews.text: Put together using a power screw driver, took about an hour start to finish, seems to be doing the job, no squeaks, under a new Leesa foam mattress and I've not slept better in my 75 years. My foxhound also gives it 5 stars. What a life she has! New mattress and foundation. Pays no rent. Free meals. Makes the rounds to neighborhood businesses begging treats every day. And everyone thinks she's a darling. What a racket!!
customer_reviews.author: Roger R.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and easy assembly!
customer_reviews.text: For me, this was a DREAM! If it hadn't been for someone shorting me on 2 of the wood screws, it would have taken me only 20 minutes to fully assemble! Did it in 22, but I used a ratchet wrench and an electric screwdriver. To make it efficient, I placed all of (save 2) the wood screws in the holes and screwed them in like a race car pit crew. The wood was solid and of high quality and best of all... I didn't need to borrow someone's truck to get it! I HIGHLY recommend buying, if you live in a place that can't fit a box spring or you lack the proper transportation mode for one. KUDOS!!!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Amazon warehouse and delivery; sloppy handling.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon messed up badly. The actual product seemed to be good. 1st.). They sent me the wrong size. I checked and yep, it was clearly stated on the order 2nd.) Box came all busted up with hardware falling out. Mind you this was an Amazon truck delivery not UPS. Even delivery truck driver handed me hardware that he found in his van. ONE OF THE BOLTS WAS EVEN BENT beyond use. The product probably would have been good otherwise. The product looked intact and good quality. It was incompetence on Amazons part. I’m reluctant to try again hoping they get it right. Returned for full refund. Too bad too. Would have filled the need well, I think.
customer_reviews.author: Keri Mcnabb

customer_reviews.title: Great Frame
customer_reviews.text: Really good frame for the money and really easy to setup. The cover is great and looks nice and cover the wood frame well. I fit perfectly in the ikea brimnes king bed frame. One thing I would suggest is to get some foam tape about 1inch thick or 3/4 and line the bed frame edges and some parts of the frame so that it doesnt move when you do stuff on the bed and it wont make noise.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitriy Ulko

customer_reviews.title: Good product at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: My "78" year-young mother needed a low box spring for her new mattress. Her feet dangled over the bed on her traditional box spring. This product allows her to get in and out of bed without feeling as if she is falling or sliding out. I also like the fact that it was made here in the USA. It arrived quickly, was easy to assemble, and the cover went on easy as well. Did not need to add any additional slats as some reviews suggested, as the full seemed very sturdy. We did use wood glue though. We are all very happy with the price, product, and quality. I would recommend this product without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: R, Magee

customer_reviews.title: Priced well and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: No big issues- they were easy to assemble- the most difficult part was getting the cover on and pulling the drawstring tight enough to secure. Had a panic moment when I opened the boxes, though. It appeared that the foundation cover included was not white, as represented, but brown! After completely unfolding one, I realized that the brown area would be invisible under the slats and that the sides were indeed white. One star deducted because the foundation cover isn’t washable, and some of the stitching unraveled with simple handling.
customer_reviews.author: PugFan

customer_reviews.title: The breaker of beds has met his match.
customer_reviews.text: After slaying 2 metal bed frames and an ikea frame I purchased this one as a last resort before I threw in the towel. This box spring requires a bit of assembly and felt a little flimsy until it was fully assembled. Upon first use it creaked and popped but settled in without any problems. I've gone through several ummm "friends" while this bed has been in my service and it has performed admirably.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Pliskin

customer_reviews.title: 100% impressed and satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what buyers expect, but this solution for having a "foundation" for a mattress is PERFECT for us. DO NOT PANIC if the carton arrives banged up a bit. The care in how the actual components are packaged is impressive. The process for assembly is SO EASY and intuitive (and I'm not really a "build-stuff-all-the-time" sort of person). I had it together and in place in less than 30 minutes. I ADMIT: I USED A RATCHETING WRENCH instead of the provided wrench tool, but it was easy and the finished product is of excellent quality. Solid, well-designed, well-considered for the end-user.
customer_reviews.author: Wingman Aloha

customer_reviews.title: Do It Yourself Kit NOT BOXSPRING
customer_reviews.text: Rip off!!! They must pay for the reviews mine is 100% accurate. Please look at photos AND video. My first error was not watching the video. I thought the images were showing how tbe boxspring is built by thrm. No... This should be labeled BOXSPRING DO-IT-YOURSELF KIT. Literally I got wood pieces and screws. This is a scam otherwise why didn't hey show a pic of pieces on cover? No instead they add a video on the very bottom. Also 2 pieces were not correct length as I struggled to assemble it. Being that I'm disabled I can't bring this to be returned so I'm out $98 and my son still has no boxspring so thanks a lot.
customer_reviews.author: MasterReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Construction job
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this was a challenge for me to put together, im an old lady, and didnt expect to have to work this hard. Now i wish i had gotten one of the folding metal box springs, we just wanted more support for our platform bed. Now that its on the bed, its fine. The cover was also hard to get on, and i dont like how it shows when the bed isnt made. I am looking for a cover to put over it. Price was good, and its the right height.
customer_reviews.author: savta

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly is not too difficult despite poor instructions, so a splinter and tree sap on my hands later, I managed to put it together just fine. So far so good. Put the thing on our bed and it started creaking loudly the second my husband sat on the bed...and before you ask, we are average sized people (168 and 125 lbs respectively) so we didn't go over the weight limit. Let's just say that this product has certainly put a damper in our "private time" and we will replace it as soon as possible! (Not sure how to return it since it's so big!)
customer_reviews.author: Daniela Christopherson

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly, poor cover
customer_reviews.text: Wood frame is pretty simple, solid, and not super heavy (at least with the Full size). We were able to assemble it within half an hour. However, the cover provided was a disappointment. Other similar products have tight-fitting zippered all-around covers. This one is sort of a throw-on and doesn’t have a bottom — you need to pull edge strings to make it (somewhat) wrap the frame. I didn’t like that the bottom remains open and the box spring cover stays kind of loose.
customer_reviews.author: vigil12

customer_reviews.title: The 4" metal queen size one
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised, but the 4" metal queen size frame, came folded in 4 so the box was not near as large as I was expecting. Assembling it was simple and took all of 2 minutes. You unfold it, put the cover on one edge and pull over the rest of the frame and zipper it up. The last few inches of the zipper did take a little manipulation, but that was it. Seems stable and OK so far, not sure how it holds up long term though.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Price is good, but the constant creaking noises are obnoxious
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for box spring for over three years now. It was easy to assemble. It sits on top of our king bed that has 4 wooden support bars. The wood on wood makes an obnoxious creaking noise. Lifting everything off and the frame and putting it in a slightly different position will help for a night or two, but it always returns. I'd suggest looking elsewhere for a box spring if you're sensitive to noises (and I'm not talking about the fun activities that make noise, just the simple act of rolling over and getting out of bed).
customer_reviews.author: skooba

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit standard twin unless you are prepared to redrill holes and assemble differently a
customer_reviews.text: More than assemble, I had to remanufacture this to fit. First, when assembling as pictured, all of the slats were too long and would not fit in slots. Further, the unit would not fit in my standard twin bed. I disassembled, redrilled new holes which made it wider (all though weaker since neither head nor foot boards now res on my bed rails. These frames are clearly mass produced with cheap, warping pine and there appears to be no real quality check. Do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: david scruggs

customer_reviews.title: 30 minutes to build with Phillips Head Screw Driver Bit and 1/2 inch Socket Wrench
customer_reviews.text: This platform solved a problem for me. I have a very narrow stair case and was unable to get a Queen Size Platform or Box Spring up the steps. It was between getting this or 2 single size Box Spring. I suggest you use a half inch Socket Wrench and a Drill with a Screwdriver Bit (only 2 tools needed). Comes with a 1⁄2 inch Open End Wrench if you do not have a socket set. Took about 30 minutes to build it. Clever idea and I would recommend this Platform.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. I did make a couple additions during assembly just to make sure it stayed sturdy. In addition to screwing the slats I also added wood glue. I also added a board down the middle lengthwise and screwed the slats to that as well. Very sturdy and stable.
customer_reviews.author: RWPINTHEMIDWEST

customer_reviews.title: We are very pleased with this foundation
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 2 queen size 4". The main reason we chose these is because they are made by the Amish. The foundations were perfect-screws lined up perfectly and except for one place that was a bit damaged by where one of the slats go, it was easily fixable but should have been fixed before we got it. One of the coverings also had a stain on it but it came out immediately with Shout spray. So we are 100% pleased with both foundations and would highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: punkin

customer_reviews.title: Okay, once I actually recieved the complete kit
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this under my Prime membership in plenty of time for a guest's use. Well, it arrived late and without appropriate hardware. I had to repackage the item for return and wait for a replacement. Replacement arrived with all of the necessary parts and assembly was easy enough. We did purchase extra slats (furring strips) from the hardware store based on another reviewer's recommendation. We cut them to fit and predrilled to prevent splitting. All in all we are happy with the end result as it it light weight and we really wanted wood, not metal. We recommend the product, it was just a bit of a battle in receiving what we actually ordered.
customer_reviews.author: CMH

customer_reviews.title: Great Support and Quality
customer_reviews.text: This foundation is amazing. My wife and I have a great bed frame that we loved the design of, but the slats and support system made our mattress feel horrible. The quality of this is great, and following the lead of another reviewer I added additional slats to get a little more support. I think they were needed since I have a memory foam mattress. Anyway, after putting it together and placing my mattress on top, the difference was immediately noticeable. I highly recommend this for great support and quality!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t sure how sturdy this mattress foundation would be, since it is a folding unit but I was pleasantly surprised. This thing is solid!! It feels like I have a whole new mattress. Even with my extremely heavy mattress, this frame holds the weight. I’m very impressed, and at half the cost of similar items elsewhere!!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Solid piece
customer_reviews.text: I moved into a home where the staircase was narrow so my regular box spring would absolutely not fit upstairs. So, this boxspring that you assemble yourself was a perfect solution. It took a few minutes to figure out which parts were which, but it is easy to figure out. Then, from there, the entire assembly maybe took 20 minutes or so by myself. All the tools you need come in the box with the exception of a screwdriver. Easy to assemble, works perfectly, and seems to be very solid.
customer_reviews.author: Kara Moore

customer_reviews.title: Works well with my foam mattress
customer_reviews.text: I have a Tempur-Pedic foam mattress. Like many people, I had problems with the foundation that came with the mattress: It creaked and groaned, due to design flaws. Replacement ones are in the hundreds, so I decided to try this model. I'm pretty happy with it. Assembly is easy; it took about 45 minutes. They include a few extra parts, like bolts and nuts -- a nice touch. I'm pleased to report that it is silent. Compared to my old foundation, this one doesn't make a sound. And I like the lower-profile look on my bed. And, unlike the original model, it can be disassembled if I ever want to move it.
customer_reviews.author: StealyDan

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressive Frame
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I am very impressed with this frame! From stripping the bed to moving the mattress out and back, assembling the complete frame, stretching the cover onto the frame and remaking the bed, 30 minutes with no assistance. And, that’s without even reading the directions. The bed is that easy and simple to assemble. It appears to be well built and yet lightweight overall. Once assembled, the cover basically stretches over the frame effortlessly and then just pull the draw string to keep it in place. I was wanting a simple box frame with good support and this definitely fills that need. I highly recommend this frame.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: was packaged good. It was easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: It arrived quickly, was packaged good. It was easy to assemble, I am in my 80's. I have tile in my family room so I assembled it there. I did use a cordless drill and socket wrench. I had ordered a new memory foam mattress and they said it should be on a flat surface. So, I cut up some 1/4 plywood (Lowes did it) and screwed it to the top. There is a little give to the finished product, but I didn't think that was a bad thing. The mattress is spread over a large area. You could buy all of the material and do it yourself, but I doubt you would save much money. This was simply easier.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Foster

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I bought the queen size foundation in May 2014. It was easy to assemble, fits my frame, and is quite sturdy, supporting over 400 lbs (two adults). The problem is the rail that runs down the middle, creating a wall between the sleepers. Not so great for a couple that likes each other. I keep adding pads, but nothing helps. Time to get rid of it.
customer_reviews.author: Msfranxie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what we needed
customer_reviews.text: We bought a new platform bed for our daughter and only noticed that the mattress sits about 4" below the edge of the bed after delivery. It is really difficult (and painful) to lift a heavy mattress and tuck in the sheets with that arrangement because your hands get caught between the wooden bed side and mattress. Therefore we looked for something that could be used to raise the mattress appropriately. This box spring replacement looked ideal. Everything fits together well making it simple to assemble. It seems sturdy, the pieces of wood are all clean with no (few) knots and I think it will last for many years. No more painful hands while making the bed.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: USA made. Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: My bed was too high for me to get into after a back injury with excruciating pain and discomfort. I paid to have it assembled and installed. Also removal and disposal of original box springs. Lowered bed 6". A very good product but quality control, poor. I needed to buy additional end bolts and hardware. Also had to buy additional wood screws to secure slats. All this plus a shipping delay or some dang snafu that cost me several recovery days. I would have awarded 5 stars but not even a thank you from this vendor. USA made
customer_reviews.author: Traffic Zone n XWalk

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bed foundation. All wood and easy to assemble. My only complaint is the cover. It only covers the top and sides with a drawstring to tighten it around the foundation. If it were a complete cover that zipped closed I would give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Cboyd06

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Solution for my new bed!
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect solution for me as my 8ish inch box spring was way too high for my new headboard. Yes the box itself is on the heavy side but you can open the box and easily move the wood pieces individually. I was very impressed with how easy it was to assemble. I tried buying a low profile box spring at a big box or department store but they didn't carry them in stock and I didn't know how to get it home even if I could find one (strap it to roof I guess) but this Instant Foundation worked wonderfully. Fast delivery, easy assembly, stable, and looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Creaks!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mainly for the low profile. However, description says it’s noise free- we have a new hybrid mattress (memory foam/coils) and this frame is not noise free. Creaks worse than my old box spring and I tightened every bolt snug. Can’t get in or out without disturbing spouse due to loud creaks. Might be ok for all memory foam but not hybrid for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Glen A Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time or your money.
customer_reviews.text: I'm so disappointed in this. After spending an hour building this, I guess I'll have to spend another one taking it apart so I can return it. This is supposed to be a king size, as you can tell from the photos, it's over and in too short and THREE inches too narrow. And no, I don't have a California king - my bed is over 100 years old, and they didn't make those back then.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great construction and easy to add slats
customer_reviews.text: Queen bed - Great construction, easy to put together with the tools provided. I added 11 slats in between the provided ones for ~23 dollars. Would definitely recommend! For those interested for a queen bed: -11 - 2.5"x 8' boards cut to 56" length (~$2/each from lowes/home depot) -33 - 1-1/4" construction screws (~$2 from walmart) Predrill holes similar to the ones provided and you should have no problems putting the extra slats in between. I am using this for a latex mattress and it works perfectly. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Tech lover

customer_reviews.title: This has been the perfect replacement. It was easy to put together even ...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a replacement to my existing box springs and wanted something that wasn't as tall as my existing box springs. This has been the perfect replacement. It was easy to put together even though the instructions were a bit minimal. Some might want to consider wearing work gloves while assembling this. It's rough, unfinished wood and there can be splinters. But I was careful handling the pieces and didn't get any splinters. Although a wrench was supplied to use on the bolts, I had a ratcheting wrench which made the bolting it together much easier. Very pleased and very happy with this
customer_reviews.author: Sandpiper

customer_reviews.title: This was the perfect solution to bringing down the height of a bed ...
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect solution to bringing down the height of a bed my mother loved after an injury prohibited her from climbing up into it. This "box spring" is really a wooden platform to support a mattress, but it is beautifully made, and after we my husband assembled it, we were so pleased. It comes with a white cloth cover that can be removed for cleaning. My mom finds it quite comfortable. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Simpson

customer_reviews.title: solid foundation
customer_reviews.text: The assembly arrived quickly. I followed the recommendations of others and added additional slats and put glue between the slats and the frame before putting the screws in. A ratchet wrench with a 1/2 in. socket and an electric screwdriver makes the assembly a lot easier. The assembled foundation is heavy. It works well with my king size mattress. If you have access to a heavy-duty stapler, you can staple the cover to the frame instead of relying on the drawstring to keep it in place.
customer_reviews.author: casual photographer

customer_reviews.title: Great Foundation
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace a box spring with something that could be easily be moved up and down our stairs or broken down into smaller pieces. This fit the bill and so far has been fantastic. Included everything as described and putting it together was easy. Would recommend anyone purchasing this have a drill or some type of powered device, because doing all those screws by hand would probably be a pain. Fits on our frame perfectly and doesn't make any noise.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Perfect height.  Strong and durable.  Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: I did alot of research first for a box spring prior to ordering this one. This product is great! When I first opened the big box I wasn’t sure what to expect and this item had to be put together. With long pieces of wood, screws, nuts and bolts. Well it was very easy to assemble. The only tool I needed was a screwdriver and I am very happy with this product! It’s strong and durable and all the precut pieces fit in to the slots perfectly. I would definitely recommend this product to others!!
customer_reviews.author: Lori D

customer_reviews.title: well made
customer_reviews.text: The low profile box spring (about 4inches) is great. It makes the bed much easier to get in and out of, which for an elderly person is great. It was very easy to put together, though a power screw driver is essential, as each plank has to be individually attached to the frame. The cover is a nice touch, with the end result looking very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Don Lohrey

customer_reviews.title: It feels like a different bed and no longer has any low ...
customer_reviews.text: My child's bed had some wood slats, but it did not support the mattress enough. I added this to do the job. WOW! It feels like a different bed and no longer has any low sags. I would buy this foundation again for any bed in my house where it works better than the classic box springs being plywood or the cheap wood substitutes. It is a very worthy solid wood product. I've bought Amish furniture before with great honest craftsmanship so I tried the foundation. It was easy to put together as my younger son helped Dad for their project. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: JCS

customer_reviews.title: Great foundation, but make sure you get the right kind of frame.
customer_reviews.text: This foundation is pretty easy to put together, and seems quite sturdy. I added 11 1x2's to leave smaller gaps for my foam mattress like several others have. One thing to look out for: I had ordered a steel frame with center support at the same time, but as I was putting the foundation together, I realized that the frame I got had a "vertical" (top to bottom) center support which wouldn't come in contact with any wood (because the 2 inner beams are also vertical), so I am returning the frame and getting one with a side-to-side center support. I hadn't seen this warning anywhere else, so wanted to give future buyers a heads up.
customer_reviews.author: Jay K

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: During the assembly process I discovered multiple defects in the product. 1) center support beam cracked 50% through. 2) corner anchor split in half. 3) a predrilled hole with a staple strait through it. Now that the product is fulled assembled I question how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: 4 1/2" tall foundation
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy mattress foundation. We've had the higher profile one for a while. Very useful for getting up narrow stair cases. We decided to get the lower profile 4" version and bed risers to lower the overall bed height while increasing the clearance under the bed for extra storage. It might not make much of a difference to anyone else, but the foundation is actually 4 1/2" tall. That 1/2" made a difference in my project so wanted to share. Also, one of the ends of the wood was chipped off. Easily fixed with wood glue and clamps so not going to return it.
customer_reviews.author: T Rex

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Low Profile 4-Inch Box-Spring
customer_reviews.text: I had a normal box spring with a mattress with a pillow top. The wooden bed frame I bought required a low profile box spring to fit correctly. This low profile box spring is very well built with wood frame and slats. All the wood was in good condition and everything fit together easily (nuts and bolts for the frame and screws for the slats) . The slats even had pre-drilled holes to make assembly easier. The directions were good and no parts were missing. This is a very solid box spring and a good value.
customer_reviews.author: p.sean hynson

customer_reviews.title: Foundation is OK but can be improved upon...
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly, Strong enough and seems OK but 4 1/2 inches between slats seems to be a wider spacing than I'd like for my memory foam mattress, so I added 11 furring strips (available at Lowes and Home Depot for $1.00-1.15 each) to reduced the spacing to 1 1/2 inches between slats. The resulting foundation should then be good for any foam mattress set. The polyester cover extends over top and sides of foundation but leaves the bottom side open... some folks might want to staple on a dust cover to the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Skipmuck47

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with low foundation “boxspring”. Was thinking this was going to be actual, traditional boxspring but it arrived in long, very heavy box with wooden pieces. I purchased for elderly mother whose bed was too high. I admit that my brother took care of this project, but he said it was easy, and I watched him. It is a framework of wooden slats that wind up similar to a pallet. It has a drawstring cover. He said wood was soft enough for hand screwdriver as he didn’t bring a drill. Mom is VERY discerning, but she was very pleased immediately when her feet could now touch the floor. Problem solved and great product for reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Adele Peters

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was super easy to set up. It probably took about 30 minutes but I had a 3 year old "helping" me. Lol. My only down side is that after some time the fabric cover loosens and you have to tighten it, but that's not too bad. Just so everyone knows there is no fabric across the bottom like with most box springs. I don't mind this and it was not a factor in my rating but I though I'd give you a heads up. Also, the wood smells soooo nice. :)
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the DIY box spring. I wanted a low profile queen one, so I got the 4”. Packaging was fine, assemblage was easy (I am a crafty/hands on type so I enjoyed this). It could be easy for anyone else too but you have to be patient while screwing in everything and make sure they’re tight. It’s fine quality and strong. Does not squeak or crack at all. My husband is a hefty man too, and it holds both our weight combined. The cover was easy as well. I am very satisfied and would buy again and reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: works well, allows me to use the bed frame we have
customer_reviews.text: It seems as if most of the memory foam mattresses come with a metal frame that has many cross pieces to support the mattress. I wanted to be able to use the bed frame we have that goes with the bedroom set. This filled the bill and works well. It does raise the mattress a bit above the side rails, which I would prefer it not do, but I am willing to put up with that because it does support the mattress well.
customer_reviews.author: comfortfirst

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. I suggest using your own socket for the bolts and a drill for the screws. 15 minutes(maybe) it took to build. Seems sturdy. Not heavy but awkward like other ones to maneuver around since it's not like those folding metal ones that are out there.
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: This is well worth it
customer_reviews.text: This "box spring" replacement is a nifty device; I had no idea you could get one of these by mail. It was incredibly easy to assemble. With a drill, one man can do it himself in 15 minutes. Nice & easy, and rock solid
customer_reviews.author: Business Book Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: This saved us! Moving my elderly mother into our home, we discovered her bed was too high for her to get into after an injury. We purchased the lowest foundation, came nicely packaged and was very easy to put together. She has slept on it for a month with no squeaks or problems! Fits beautifully in a twin sleigh bed frame with room to spare on either side.
customer_reviews.author: Antisocial 1

customer_reviews.title: Holds up during fornication
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality holds up like its suppose to during fornication.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful foundation and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I easily built this foundation and we are both 70........and I had a broken elbow at the time, also. The pieces were nicely finished, just as one would expect from Amish builders. We are VERY happy with this box spring. It needs no extra boards than supplied for a King mattress.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: This box spring was recommended by T&N mattress Co
customer_reviews.text: This box spring was recommended by T&N mattress Co. When I ordered I looked and looked but could not find the measurements, so I thought if the mattress,is personally recommending this then I'll go ahead and get it. My mattress queen mattress hangs over the box spring. I would not have purchased this if I had known it was not the exact measurements of the mattress. I have contacted T&N, and there response was basically just acknowledgeing my frustration. Nothing else. T&N recommends on their website that the foundation should be the same size or larger than their mattress. I'm Not happy. As you see this box spring had to be assembled, along with the metal frame.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay, quality of wood is questionable
customer_reviews.text: Im taking away a star because I question the longevity of this product. Some of the woods were already split and some became split as I was putting the screws in them. It was easy to put together but the quality of the wood is not the best I think it should be cheaper. If your a heavy set person I would avoid this box frame.
customer_reviews.author: Rebell Entertainment

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, lousy instructions
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, lousy instructions! I am an engineer and I had some difficulty. The screws DO fit, try them both ways first. Also see if you can find a ratchet wrench with a deep 1/2 inch socket, that will speed things along and a power screwdriver helps, but it is not absolutely necessary. In the end it came together in about an hour. Also the package weighs about 70 lbs, so you may need help moving it around. My mattress manufacturer recommends 4 in spacing for the slats, I added 11 slats from Lowe's.
customer_reviews.author: F. ZLOTNICK

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied!!!
customer_reviews.text: When we moved into our new house, our queen box wouldn't fit up the stairs. After calling around to several matress places, we were told it would be well over $200 for a split box. Seemed a bit expensive for a wood frame. Alas, I somehow stumbled across this. The instant foundation was a breeze to assemble. Don't believe me? Ask my 6 year old daughter who spearheaded the project and my 8 year old son who handled the wood screws. It went together perfectly, everything fit as it should, and it's super solid. Haven't heard a peep out of it either. DEFINITELY worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: PR

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for a new king bed and my husband put it together in about 30 minutes. It hooks together beautifully and if you use a socket wrench, the assembly process is much faster. I am going to order another one, you can't go wrong with Amish construction!! This is so well made, I wish I had known about it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Great product, would purchase again
customer_reviews.text: Would purchase again! Very easy to set up with just one person, not very heavy, easy to maneuver. We’ve owned this for about 9 months now and my only complaint is that one of our slats leaks tree sap on our carpet. We noticed because we looked under the bed for something and there’s at least a half teaspoon of sap on the carpet. We’ll have to find a solution for this so it doesn’t continue dripping long term. Other than that, we’re very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Terrrific Product
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed by the design, engineering and manufacture of this product. Everything fit perfectly and it was actualy fun to put together instead of the chore some things are. It did exactly what we needed- it lowered our bed height so we could use a 50 year old head and foot board with a modern, much thicker mattress than it was originally designed for.. The mattress now feels much better than it did with our old box spring. We purchased this from Amazon-not a freebe in return for a review.
customer_reviews.author: Walker D. West

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, no squeaks or creaks and my room smells great too :)
customer_reviews.text: We had it setup in 30 min! Very easy to install. The frame is light weight, and really quiet. The wrench provided is excellent though you must provide your own screw driver. We installed it right on the bed slats, which was easier than putting it all together and then moving it. The wood is untreated and smells amazing and fresh! I must say this box spring replacement seems much sturdier than those in the store. Also the cover is nice, fits well.
customer_reviews.author: DigiReviews

customer_reviews.title: Have already recommended this product
customer_reviews.text: So far, I am happy with the ease of installation and quality of materials, including the cover. Packaged the cover appear inferior,, but it is well made and fits great. It took me 30 minutes to build the platform, but i admit i borrowed my husbands 1/2" rachetting socket wrench. The direction were simple, clear, and for once correct. The middle support (queen) frame was marked this side up and all the support slatts were predrilled (simple pleasures) Tonight is the first night we sleep on the platform, so stay tuned regarding noises.
customer_reviews.author: Jordanna Williams

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Memory Foam Mattress
customer_reviews.text: The product met my expectations, with ease of assembly being paramount. I felt the gaps between slats too great for the memory foam mattress so some simple solutions were needed. My grandsons disassemble the old box springs and we used the would slats. Measuring and sanding was next along with holes drilled on all our slats. Adding a small drop of wood glue at each mounting location made the final process of placing the slats in place very easy. We have not creaking sounds and the foundation is very secure within the bed metal frame. Very satisfied with the outcome.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: I bought this 3 years ago for a foam mattress ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 3 years ago for a foam mattress. It was a bit of a pain to put together. But more importantly, now a few years later, I'm not thrilled. The bed squeaks often. We tried tightening everything in this frame but it doesn't help.
customer_reviews.author: K. E Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended, very sturdy and quality bed slat foundation
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two full sized platforms to go with some Tuft & Needle mattresses. They were pretty easy to put together. That being said, it is much easier with a socket and an electric drill to screw down the slats. Although the wood isn't super smooth, the texture was not that bad. I did not need gloves to assemble the two I had. Once the cover is on it, the roughness doesn't matter. This is a huge step up from the standard individual slats. The platform is pretty heavy and sturdy. I am very pleased with this purchase and will be ordering additional ones as I have to replace other old bed slats.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does The Job
customer_reviews.text: As a city dweller who suddenly found herself in need of box spring when switching from a platform to a standard frame, this box spring was very convenient, easy to put together, and looked good when done. I'm not, however, keen about the underside being open to ... kitty or critter hideout, so will likely staple some fabric to the bottom for coverage, which is why I pulled one star.
customer_reviews.author: PMae

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy!
customer_reviews.text: Loved that these came in the mail and were a 2-minute set-up. Just pop them open, zip the cover and you're good to go! My only complaint is that the corners weren't well protected so the cover has some small tears in it where the corners pinches the fabric during transit. But it's not noticeable once the mattress, sheets and bedspread are on so no worries!
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: Solid Foundation
customer_reviews.text: To be honest I was a little leery about this box spring when it came in. It seemed only too simplistic to be very sturdy to support my mattress, myself and wife. I was wrong. Although simple design and construction, this mattress foundation is extremely sturdy! Once constructed it is also fairly light weight compared many other box springs on the market. Only gave four stars because it does require to be assembled. I would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Great assemble yourself fondation
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this item is top notch. Wooden and made perfectly. It did take about 1 and 1/2 hours to assemble. Comes with a little nut wrench but use a better one and it'll help. Also a drill or electric screwdriver to drive in the slat wood screws will make life easier. Otherwise this is a great purchase. The cover for it is top notch and looks great when finished.
customer_reviews.author: dwcleck

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted to support my new mattress
customer_reviews.text: I bought a bed in box mattress to replace my old mattress. I had not planned on purchasing a box spring but needed to add some height. This was a great choice. Easy to put up as it comes assembled, sturdy, no creaking as I read could happen with wooden frames and perfect height. Very good value.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Not For Foam Mattress
customer_reviews.text: This an okay product, but there aren't enough slats to support a foam mattress since the slats are too far apart. The ad says it will support a heavy foam mattress. Classic Brands should add a caveat that many foam mattress manufacturers recommend slats that are less than 4 inches apart.
customer_reviews.author: deadeye

customer_reviews.title: Overall, you get more for your money
customer_reviews.text: Despite the low price, the foundation was easy to put together with all wood pieces (pine). I was sure a few pieces would be 'off ' a bit or not line up to the pre-drilled holes, but I was wrong. My only recommendation is to add some wood glue to the joints and slats where they connect. This really makes it even more solid and was easy to do. The cover is good, and not cheaply made. Overall, I think you get more for your money, but you have to be willing to put the frame together.
customer_reviews.author: Keystone

customer_reviews.title: It will get the job done
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my new Layla queen mattress. Easy to put together but use a cordless screw driver. If you can’t figure out how to put this together, somethings wrong with you lol It’s a basic foundation. Fits the mattress perfectly. I did not need extra slats like others have added. Seems well made. Would be great if they added caster wheels so it was just a bit higher off the floor & easier to move. That’s the reason I knocked it down a star.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Early

customer_reviews.title: This Low Profile Box Spring Replacement is VERY NOISY!
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a low profile box to lower the overall height of the bed and get one at a decent price. The low profile is great. The box had to be put together, which wasn't difficult. But, the nature of it being a wood frame held together by bolts, when you move on the bed (we have a Tempurpedic foam mattress on it) the box makes a lot of relatively loud wood-on-wood noises. Loud enough to wake up your sleeping partner. Consider your options carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Williams

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly box spring
customer_reviews.text: We had to put together. I thought I ordered something that looked like the picture. It came in a long skinny box. It's basically wood sides, slats and a black covering that covers up the whole thing once assembled. I hope it holds up. Just glad it's for an extra bedroom that will rarely be slept in.
customer_reviews.author: Belinda J Fry

customer_reviews.title: Great Foundation...Must Assemble...It's Easy
customer_reviews.text: When this product came in a narrow, but long box I was concerned. I thought "my husband is going to kill me as he will have to put this together." We were pleasantly surprised when this was easy to put together and we had no issues at all. It took him less than an hour to put it together. It is a solid box spring and has functioned well for the last week. Next time I will read the reviews, so at least I know how it will come. That was my fault though.
customer_reviews.author: Lori G

customer_reviews.title: This was extremely easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: This was extremely easy to put together. Just be careful not to put the bolts in too tightly. We made that mistake and cracked the wood slightly but not enough to hurt the integrity of the box springs. We have a very tall queen sized bed frame with the mattress held up by only slats; the low profile box springs only added four inches and made our mattress more comfortable by having no more mattress slumping. As other comments have mentioned, there is a chance of getting splinters if you aren't careful. The drawstring cover was really nice material.
customer_reviews.author: ARB

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second full size mattress foundation I have parched through Amazon and I am once again very happy with the simplicity and stability of this product. The 1st I got for my own guests room and now this one for my mother's roomate/ air B&B room. It is a bit cheaper than a standard box spring and is delivered right to you doorstep. It is not hard at all to put together if you have even the most basic of mechanical skill. If you can turn a wrench and screwdriver you can put this together. The one I got 1st for me has held up wonderfully and I think this new one will too.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: great foundation for any mattress
customer_reviews.text: I like that this frame was would it was easy to install the provides a solid stable foundation for my mattress which I need I recommend this frame to a lot of my friends and family as it's not metal it is would the cover codes on easy it's pretty light it is definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!! Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Saved me from buying a new mattress and foundation. I bought a bed and foundation from sit n sleep about a year ago, the wood broke it was cheap. My bed had sunk in the middle. I saw the pictures people posted of this. It looked so sturdy! Long story short, it fixed all my problems. Kept my mattress which is still as good as new. My original bed frame (headboard footboard) and this made my better sturdier than when I first bought it. It's amazing!!!
customer_reviews.author: jess

customer_reviews.title: sure enough it slides between the rails just fine. probably closer to 75 inches wide for a ...
customer_reviews.text: no directions required. 1/2 inch wrench included. you will need a screw driver (drill recommended). cover is very thick around the edges. realize the dimensions listed are for the bed frame this fits into. my king bed frame is 76 inches from rail to rail and I was worried this wouldn't fit. when I read on here that it was a little smaller than advertised I was confident it would fit. sure enough it slides between the rails just fine. probably closer to 75 inches wide for a king. this is exactly how wide my sealy box spring was. great product.
customer_reviews.author: Ant

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly, works fine, sleeping on it nightly
customer_reviews.text: The package was undamaged, but the internal packing was poor -- the hardware bag was open and dumped all the contents loose inside the package. However, every single screw and nut was present, and it was easy to assemble and worked perfectly. They do need to work on internal packaging, but the product was great -- socket wrench and screw gun and it took only 15 minutes or so to have a perfect foundation.
customer_reviews.author: Linwood

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Works well with our low profile bed frame. It was very easy to assemble, although the instructions could have been a little more clear for the model that we purchased (King size). Assembly hardware was good quality, and the slats were very easy to screw in with a cordless drill.
customer_reviews.author: S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for my parents bed since their original box spring was too high and dangerous for them to get in and out of bed. They had taken the original out and were just using the mattress which was difficult for them because then the bed was too low and it put a strain on their backs. This was a perfect compromise for them. The only thing that I had to laugh about was I was expecting to receive a fully put together product and not one that I had to build. Thankfully my nephew was there and the two of us were able to put it together in no time. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for my foam mattress
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the wood is nothing exceptional, but it works as advertised without any issues. I was able to follow the limited instructions without any problem, and I am not a handy person. I thought that it is well built and has stayed together nicely over the course of a month. It took about 30-45 minutes of set-up time, but it was worth it. I would say that it may be difficult to take this apart and re-assemble it. The slats are enough support for our true foam mattress and I have not had any issues with squeaking or support.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great support!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the queen size a year ago and have found it to be sturdy and durable. So when my youngest moved back home and needed a full size foundation I ordered another one for her. It's very easy to assemble, even for one person. Good materials. I have a 10-inch memory foam mattress. My daughter's matteress is a super plush 17-inches. If you're a large person, you can be confident that this foundation will give great support. I have recommended this to several friends as a cost saving alternative to over-priced mattress stores.
customer_reviews.author: E. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Missing bolts
customer_reviews.text: A couple bolts were missing. It is good quality but who ever sent the hardware didn’t send it complete. Poor management
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Measure Your Bed!
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of not looking to ensure that a "low profile" would be right for my space. There is nothing less lackluster than a short bed in an elegant bedroom set. I ended up having to order a traditional boxspring from a mattress store and the $ I spent on the box spring was a loss. They had an option to return it, but I couldn't event think about trying to disassemble it and fit it back in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Sewcialite

customer_reviews.title: Great solution to overpriced foundations!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic product for those of us who might already have a mattress and don't want to spend $300+ on the foundation. It's relatively quick and easy to assemble, arriving in simple, yet robust packaging. And really makes it a different experience versus sleeping with the mattress directly on your frame. Obviously if you're getting a mattress + foundation combo, you'll likely pay almost nothing for a good foundation. But if you're like me and found a great deal on a solo mattress that was delivered separately, we couldn't find anything short of $300 delivered to the house. This was a phenomenal solution to that.
customer_reviews.author: JayO

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great find! I needed a lower profile foundation for my antique bedroom set. Went together easily once I got a ratchet. The one and only thing I didn't like was the tool that comes in the set to tighten up the bolts (that's why I got a ratchet). Solid wood, pre drilled holes fit together perfect. Would buy again if ever in the market for another one. The cover that goes on when it's built was a little hard for just me to put on, I had to have my husband help me.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

product_meta.title: Classic Brands Instant Foundation High Profile 8-Inch Box-Spring Replacement, Queen
product_meta.description:
Size:Queen| Style:High Profile Wood

Classic Brands High-Profile 8-inch Instant Foundation is an inexpensive solution that provides the perfect support for all mattress types. Prevent sagging and increase your mattress's longevity by adding this durable foundation to your sleep system. The drawstring cover is easily removable and coordinates well with most mattresses. The compact foundation ships in manageable pieces for easy assembly and comes with a three-year worry-free warranty. Available in Twin, Twin XL, Full, Full XL, Queen, King, and California King sizes.

 Is it a Foundation or a Box-Spring? 
This is a common question-they are essentially the same thing. They serve the same purpose to provide support for all mattress types. The Classic Brands High-Profile 8-Inch Instant Foundation as the name applies, is easily assembled. The solid spruce foundation is made is the USA in Pennsylvania Amish Country and ships with all parts and directions needed for assembly and includes a cotton blend cover.


 Benefits of the High-Profile Foundation 
The Instant Foundation is produced in the USA, in the Pennsylvania Amish country. Made of solid spruce, it will provide solid support for any mattress. It lays under the mattress, so the mattress will never sag, making an uncomfortable sleeping surface. The Instant Foundation is the perfect solution to getting a box spring at an affordable price. This Foundation ships small parcel. 


 Easy Assembly 
The Instant Foundation is easy to assemble and sets up in minutes, just unpack, assemble the frame and attach the hardware. Next simply place the wood slats on the foundation. The cotton blend cover fits perfectly over the foundation and the foundation works great with memory foam mattresses or latex mattresses. The difference in height between a low-profile and high-profile foundation will change the total height of your bed from the floor and will affect the amount of headboard that is visible behind your bed. 

> •Step 1-Unpack box and lay out all materials •Step 2-Lay out the outer perimeter of the foundation, then find the middle support slats •Step 3-Using the provided hardware, screw the sides of the foundation together-(Detailed instructions for this step are included with foundation) •Step 4-Lay slats in place on top of the frame •Step 5-Screw in slats •Step 6-Cover frame of the foundation with the provided cover and use the drawstring to secure



Get it Right the First Time 
It is also a good idea to check the size and the height of your mattress to make sure you are ordering the correct size. Keep in mind that you should combine the height of the frame, foundation, and mattress to get a gauge of the how tall your bed will be. 


Classic Brands Smart Packaging 
Smart packaging reduces the carbon footprint in the manufacturers shipping process. Our advanced packaging technology means we can ship efficiently. The compact package ships in manageable pieces for easy assembly right to your doorstep and fits easily thought tight hallways or narrow stairwells.


Quality Assurance 
Classic Brands 8-Inch High Profile Instant Foundation-Box Spring Replacement is backed with a 3-year worry-free warranty. 


Look for more innovative specialty sleep products from Classic Brands
